titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Helen Cutter Dobson papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Lauren McCune

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-10-14T12:42-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: Collection rehoused and inventory added by Lauren McCune.

did.abstract: Photographs, postcards, clippings, and diary excerpts relating to the American Red Cross and American Expeditionary Forces in France.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1953.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the library catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Helen Cutter Dobson papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: American Red Cross worker with the American Expeditionary Forces in France from 1918 to 1919.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Photographs, postcards, clippings, and diary excerpts relating to the American Red Cross and American Expeditionary Forces in France.

controlaccess.corpname: United States. Army. American Expeditionary Forces.
controlaccess.subject: World War, 1914-1918--France.
World War, 1914-1918--Medical care.

did.unittitle: La Cathédrale de Reims: Un Crime Allemand,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Written by Monseigneur Maurice Landrieux, Curé de la Cathédrale de Reims (1912-1916).

did.unittitle: Clippings and photographs included within La Cathédrale de Reims: Un Crime Allemand,
